snippet: Corporations and private equity have billions of dollars on hand that they could use to empower innovation to end the economic slump. But how best to start the wheels turning?
abstract: Clayton M Christensen Bright Ideas column contends that corporations and private equity firms have billions of dollars on hand that they could use to empower innovation to end the economic slump; holds part of the economic solution lies in three ideas: changing the metrics, changing the capital-gains tax rates and changing the politics.
lead_paragraph: Corporations and private equity have billions of dollars on hand that they could use to empower innovation to end the economic slump. But how best to start the wheels turning?
